H0.text: A landslide is the natural disaster most likely to cause the most widespread damage in a coastal ecosystem.

H1.text: A tornado is likely to cause the most widespread damage in a coastal ecosystem.

H2.text: A tsunami is the natural disaster most likely to cause the most widespread damage in a coastal ecosystem.

H3.text: An earthquake is the natural disaster most likely to cause the most widespread damage in a coastal ecosystem.

A4.text: The destruction caused by the 2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami event mark it as the most devastating of its kind in modern times, killing around 230,000 people.

A5.text: Tsunamis are an often underestimated hazard in the Mediterranean Sea and parts of Europe.
